title: Recipe Request
content: {'recipe': {'title': 'Palak Paneer Lasagna Roll-Ups with Makhani Béchamel', 'cuisine': 'Indian-Italian Fusion', 'tags': ['vegetarian', 'fusion', 'make-ahead', 'comfort food'], 'ingredient_sections': [{'section_name': 'For the Palak Paneer Filling', 'ingredients': [{'name': 'Paneer', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'block (12-14 ounces)', 'notes': 'crumbled or grated'}, {'name': 'Baby spinach', 'amount': '10', 'unit': 'ounces', 'notes': 'fresh, washed'}, {'name': 'Tomato puree', 'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Yellow onion', 'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': 'finely chopped'}, {'name': 'Ginger-garlic paste', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Turmeric powder', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Coriander powder', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Red chili powder', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': 'adjust to taste'}, {'name': 'Garam masala powder', 'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Dry mango powder (amchur)', 'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': 'optional'}, {'name': 'Canola oil', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Salt', 'amount': 'to', 'unit': 'taste', 'notes': 'use less than usual, as cheese adds saltiness'}]}, {'section_name': 'For the Makhani Béchamel Sauce', 'ingredients': [{'name': 'Tomato puree', 'amount': '16', 'unit': 'ounces', 'notes': 'or two small cans'}, {'name': 'Butter', 'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'notes': 'or canola/olive oil'}, {'name': 'All-purpose flour', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Milk', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': 'whole milk recommended'}, {'name': 'Ginger-garlic paste', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Kashmiri red chili powder', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': 'for color and mild heat'}, {'name': 'Kasoori methi (dried fenugreek leaves)', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': 'crushed'}, {'name': 'Heavy cream', 'amount': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': 'optional, for richness'}, {'name': 'Brown sugar', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Salt', 'amount': 'to', 'unit': 'taste', 'notes': 'use sparingly, as cheese adds saltiness'}, {'name': 'Black pepper', 'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Nutmeg', 'amount': '1/8', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'notes': ''}]}, {'section_name': 'For Assembly & Topping', 'ingredients': [{'name': 'No-boil lasagna sheets', 'amount': '8', 'unit': 'sheets', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Fresh mozzarella cheese', 'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': 'shredded'}, {'name': 'Fresh grated Parmesan cheese', 'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'notes': ''}, {'name': 'Butter/Olive oil', 'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'notes': 'for drizzling, optional'}]}], 'steps': ['Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).', 'Prepare the Palak Paneer Filling: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 1 minute, then immediately transfer to an ice bath. Squeeze out excess water and finely chop or pulse in a food processor. In a pan, heat canola oil. Add onion and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry until fragrant. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Fry for 1 minute. Add tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes. Add chopped spinach and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add crumbled paneer and garam masala. Mix well. Season with salt and dry mango powder (if using).', 'Prepare the Makhani Béchamel Sauce: In a saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Add flour and whisk until smooth and a light golden color (about 2 minutes). Slowly whisk in milk, ensuring no lumps form. Add tomato puree, ginger-garlic paste, Kashmiri red chili powder, Kasoori methi, brown sugar, black pepper and nutmeg. Simmer on low-medium heat for 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens. Stir in heavy cream (if using) and season with salt to taste. Adjust seasonings as needed.', 'Assemble the Roll-Ups: Lightly boil lasagna sheets until pliable but not fully cooked (about 70% cooked). Place the boiled sheets on a tray or wooden board.', 'Spread a generous amount of palak paneer filling evenly over each lasagna sheet.', 'Roll each lasagna sheet tightly to form a roll-up.', 'Spread 80% of the makhani béchamel sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.', 'Place the lasagna roll-ups on top of the sauce in the baking dish.', 'Top the roll-ups with the remaining makhani béchamel sauce.', 'Sprinkle generously with fresh mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.', 'Drizzle with melted butter or olive oil (optional).', 'Cover the baking dish with tin foil and bake for 25-30 minutes.', 'Remove the foil and broil for 1-2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and lightly browned. Watch carefully to prevent burning.', 'Let cool for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh cilantro or basil if desired.'], 'prep_time_minutes': 30, 'cook_time_minutes': 40, 'servings': 4, 'difficulty': 'medium', 'notes': 'The Makhani Béchamel sauce can be made ahead of time. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 days and reheat before using. Adjust spice levels according to your preference. For a richer flavor, use full-fat milk and heavy cream in the sauce. You can also add chopped vegetables like carrots, bell peppers, or peas to the palak paneer filling for added texture and flavor.'}}
